intro: Acrodiclidium benense, commonly known as the Benin spurge, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, typical of the genus. Acrodiclidium benense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
